news.summary: The vast Southern Ocean around Antarctica has started to soak up more greenhouse gases from the atmosphere in recent years, helping limit climate change, after signs its uptake had stalled, a study has said.

blogs.title: Southern Ocean carbon sink bounces back with renewed vigour
blogs.summary:
The Southern Ocean takes up more carbon dioxide
than any other body of water on our planet. Though in recent
decades, this uptake has shown signs of slowing.

But the vast ocean surrounding Antarctica is
